40#ifndef socklen_t
41#define socklen_t unsigned int
42#endif

44/*%
45 * Definitions about UDP port range specification. This is a total mess of
46 * portability variants: some use sysctl (but the sysctl names vary), some use
47 * system-specific interfaces, some have the same interface for IPv4 and IPv6,
48 * some separate them, etc...
49 */
50
51/*%
52 * The last resort defaults: use all non well known port space
53 */
54#ifndef ISC_NET_PORTRANGELOW
55#define ISC_NET_PORTRANGELOW 1024
56#endif /* ISC_NET_PORTRANGELOW */
57#ifndef ISC_NET_PORTRANGEHIGH
58#define ISC_NET_PORTRANGEHIGH 65535
59#endif /* ISC_NET_PORTRANGEHIGH */
60
61#ifdef HAVE_SYSCTLBYNAME
62
63/*%
64 * sysctl variants
65 */
66#if defined(__FreeBSD__) || defined(__APPLE__) || defined(__DragonFly__)
67#define USE_SYSCTL_PORTRANGE
68#define SYSCTL_V4PORTRANGE_LOW "net.inet.ip.portrange.hifirst"
69#define SYSCTL_V4PORTRANGE_HIGH "net.inet.ip.portrange.hilast"
70#define SYSCTL_V6PORTRANGE_LOW "net.inet.ip.portrange.hifirst"
71#define SYSCTL_V6PORTRANGE_HIGH "net.inet.ip.portrange.hilast"
72#endif
73
74#ifdef __NetBSD__
75#define USE_SYSCTL_PORTRANGE
76#define SYSCTL_V4PORTRANGE_LOW "net.inet.ip.anonportmin"
77#define SYSCTL_V4PORTRANGE_HIGH "net.inet.ip.anonportmax"
78#define SYSCTL_V6PORTRANGE_LOW "net.inet6.ip6.anonportmin"
79#define SYSCTL_V6PORTRANGE_HIGH "net.inet6.ip6.anonportmax"
80#endif
81
82#else /* !HAVE_SYSCTLBYNAME */
83
84#ifdef __OpenBSD__
85#define USE_SYSCTL_PORTRANGE
86#define SYSCTL_V4PORTRANGE_LOW { CTL_NET, PF_INET, IPPROTO_IP, \
87 IPCTL_IPPORT_HIFIRSTAUTO }
88#define SYSCTL_V4PORTRANGE_HIGH { CTL_NET, PF_INET, IPPROTO_IP, \
89 IPCTL_IPPORT_HILASTAUTO }
90/* Same for IPv6 */
91#define SYSCTL_V6PORTRANGE_LOW SYSCTL_V4PORTRANGE_LOW
92#define SYSCTL_V6PORTRANGE_HIGH SYSCTL_V4PORTRANGE_HIGH
93#endif
94
95#endif /* HAVE_SYSCTLBYNAME */
96
97static isc_once_t once_ipv6only = ISC_ONCE_INIT;
98static isc_once_t once_ipv6pktinfo = ISC_ONCE_INIT;
99
100#ifndef ISC_CMSG_IP_TOS
101#ifdef __APPLE__
102#define ISC_CMSG_IP_TOS 0 /* As of 10.8.2. */
103#else /* ! __APPLE__ */
104#define ISC_CMSG_IP_TOS 1
105#endif /* ! __APPLE__ */
106#endif /* ! ISC_CMSG_IP_TOS */
107
108static isc_once_t once = ISC_ONCE_INIT;
109static isc_once_t once_dscp = ISC_ONCE_INIT;
110
111static isc_result_t ipv4_result = ISC_R_NOTFOUND;
112static isc_result_t ipv6_result = ISC_R_NOTFOUND;
113static isc_result_t unix_result = ISC_R_NOTFOUND;
114static isc_result_t ipv6only_result = ISC_R_NOTFOUND;
115static isc_result_t ipv6pktinfo_result = ISC_R_NOTFOUND;
116static unsigned int dscp_result = 0;
117
118static isc_result_t
119try_proto(int domain) {
120 int s;
121 isc_result_t result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
122 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
123
124 s = socket(domain, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
125 if (s == -1) {
126 switch (errno) {
127#ifdef EAFNOSUPPORT
128 case EAFNOSUPPORT:
129#endif
130#ifdef EPFNOSUPPORT
131 case EPFNOSUPPORT:
132#endif
133#ifdef EPROTONOSUPPORT
134 case EPROTONOSUPPORT:
135#endif
136#ifdef EINVAL
137 case EINVAL:
138#endif
139 return (ISC_R_NOTFOUND);
140 default:
141 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
142 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
143 "socket() failed: %s",
144 strbuf);
145 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
146 }
147 }
148
149 if (domain == PF_INET6) {
150 struct sockaddr_in6 sin6;
151 unsigned int len;
152
153 /*
154 * Check to see if IPv6 is broken, as is common on Linux.
155 */
156 len = sizeof(sin6);
157 if (getsockname(s, (struct sockaddr *)&sin6, (void *)&len) < 0)
158 {
159 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
160 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
161 "retrieving the address of an IPv6 "
162 "socket from the kernel failed.");
163 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
164 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
165 "IPv6 is not supported.");
166 result = ISC_R_NOTFOUND;
167 } else {
168 if (len == sizeof(struct sockaddr_in6))
169 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
170 else {
171 isc_log_write(isc_lctx,
172 ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
173 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET,
174 ISC_LOG_ERROR,
175 "IPv6 structures in kernel and "
176 "user space do not match.");
177 isc_log_write(isc_lctx,
178 ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
179 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET,
180 ISC_LOG_ERROR,
181 "IPv6 is not supported.");
182 result = ISC_R_NOTFOUND;
183 }
184 }
185 }
186
187 (void)close(s);
188
189 return (result);
190}
191
192static void
193initialize_action(void) {
194 ipv4_result = try_proto(PF_INET);
195 ipv6_result = try_proto(PF_INET6);
196#ifdef ISC_PLATFORM_HAVESYSUNH
197 unix_result = try_proto(PF_UNIX);
198#endif
199}
200
201static void
202initialize(void) {
203 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_once_do(&once, initialize_action) == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
204}
205
206isc_result_t
207isc_net_probeipv4(void) {
208 initialize();
209 return (ipv4_result);
210}
211
212isc_result_t
213isc_net_probeipv6(void) {
214 initialize();
215 return (ipv6_result);
216}
217
218isc_result_t
219isc_net_probeunix(void) {
220 initialize();
221 return (unix_result);
222}
223
224static void
225try_ipv6only(void) {
226#ifdef IPV6_V6ONLY
227 int s, on;
228 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
229#endif
230 isc_result_t result;
231
232 result = isc_net_probeipv6();
233 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
234 ipv6only_result = result;
235 return;
236 }
237
238#ifndef IPV6_V6ONLY
239 ipv6only_result = ISC_R_NOTFOUND;
240 return;
241#else
242 /* check for TCP sockets */
243 s = socket(PF_INET6, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
244 if (s == -1) {
245 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
246 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
247 "socket() failed: %s",
248 strbuf);
249 ipv6only_result = ISC_R_UNEXPECTED;
250 return;
251 }
252
253 on = 1;
254 if (setsockopt(s, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_V6ONLY, &on, sizeof(on)) < 0) {
255 ipv6only_result = ISC_R_NOTFOUND;
256 goto close;
257 }
258
259 close(s);
260
261 /* check for UDP sockets */
262 s = socket(PF_INET6, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
263 if (s == -1) {
264 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
265 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
266 "socket() failed: %s",
267 strbuf);
268 ipv6only_result = ISC_R_UNEXPECTED;
269 return;
270 }
271
272 on = 1;
273 if (setsockopt(s, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_V6ONLY, &on, sizeof(on)) < 0) {
274 ipv6only_result = ISC_R_NOTFOUND;
275 goto close;
276 }
277
278 ipv6only_result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
279
280close:
281 close(s);
282 return;
283#endif /* IPV6_V6ONLY */
284}
285
286static void
287initialize_ipv6only(void) {
288 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_once_do(&once_ipv6only,
289 try_ipv6only) == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
290}
291
292static void
293try_ipv6pktinfo(void) {
294 int s, on;
295 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
296 isc_result_t result;
297 int optname;
298
299 result = isc_net_probeipv6();
300 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
301 ipv6pktinfo_result = result;
302 return;
303 }
304
305 /* we only use this for UDP sockets */
306 s = socket(PF_INET6, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP);
307 if (s == -1) {
308 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
309 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
310 "socket() failed: %s",
311 strbuf);
312 ipv6pktinfo_result = ISC_R_UNEXPECTED;
313 return;
314 }
315
316#ifdef IPV6_RECVPKTINFO
317 optname = IPV6_RECVPKTINFO;
318#else
319 optname = IPV6_PKTINFO;
320#endif
321 on = 1;
322 if (setsockopt(s, IPPROTO_IPV6, optname, &on, sizeof(on)) < 0) {
323 ipv6pktinfo_result = ISC_R_NOTFOUND;
324 goto close;
325 }
326
327 ipv6pktinfo_result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
328
329close:
330 close(s);
331 return;
332}
333
334static void
335initialize_ipv6pktinfo(void) {
336 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_once_do(&once_ipv6pktinfo,
337 try_ipv6pktinfo) == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
338}
339
340isc_result_t
341isc_net_probe_ipv6only(void) {
342 initialize_ipv6only();
343 return (ipv6only_result);
344}
345
346isc_result_t
347isc_net_probe_ipv6pktinfo(void) {
348 initialize_ipv6pktinfo();
349 return (ipv6pktinfo_result);
350}
351
352#if ISC_CMSG_IP_TOS || defined(IPV6_TCLASS)
353
354static inline socklen_t
355cmsg_len(socklen_t len) {
356#ifdef CMSG_LEN
357 return (CMSG_LEN(len));
358#else
359 socklen_t hdrlen;
360
361 /*
362 * Cast NULL so that any pointer arithmetic performed by CMSG_DATA
363 * is correct.
364 */
365 hdrlen = (socklen_t)CMSG_DATA(((struct cmsghdr *)NULL));
366 return (hdrlen + len);
367#endif
368}
369
370static inline socklen_t
371cmsg_space(socklen_t len) {
372#ifdef CMSG_SPACE
373 return (CMSG_SPACE(len));
374#else
375 struct msghdr msg;
376 struct cmsghdr *cmsgp;
377 /*
378 * XXX: The buffer length is an ad-hoc value, but should be enough
379 * in a practical sense.
380 */
381 char dummybuf[sizeof(struct cmsghdr) + 1024];
382
383 memset(&msg, 0, sizeof(msg));
384 msg.msg_control = dummybuf;
385 msg.msg_controllen = sizeof(dummybuf);
386
387 cmsgp = (struct cmsghdr *)dummybuf;
388 cmsgp->cmsg_len = cmsg_len(len);
389
390 cmsgp = CMSG_NXTHDR(&msg, cmsgp);
391 if (cmsgp != NULL)
392 return ((char *)cmsgp - (char *)msg.msg_control);
393 else
394 return (0);
395#endif
396}
397
398/*
399 * Make a fd non-blocking.
400 */
401static isc_result_t
402make_nonblock(int fd) {
403 int ret;
404 int flags;
405 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
406#ifdef USE_FIONBIO_IOCTL
407 int on = 1;
408
409 ret = ioctl(fd, FIONBIO, (char *)&on);
410#else
411 flags = fcntl(fd, F_GETFL, 0);
412 flags |= PORT_NONBLOCK;
413 ret = fcntl(fd, F_SETFL, flags);
414#endif
415
416 if (ret == -1) {
417 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
418 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
419#ifdef USE_FIONBIO_IOCTL
420 "ioctl(%d, FIONBIO, &on): %s", fd,
421#else
422 "fcntl(%d, F_SETFL, %d): %s", fd, flags,
423#endif
424 strbuf);
425
426 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
427 }
428
429 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
430}
431
432static bool
433cmsgsend(int s, int level, int type, struct addrinfo *res) {
434 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
435 struct sockaddr_storage ss;
436 socklen_t len = sizeof(ss);
437 struct msghdr msg;
438 union {
439 struct cmsghdr h;
440 unsigned char b[256];
441 } control;
442 struct cmsghdr *cmsgp;
443 int dscp = (46 << 2); /* Expedited forwarding. */
444 struct iovec iovec;
445 char buf[1] = { 0 };
446 isc_result_t result;
447
448 if (bind(s, res->ai_addr, res->ai_addrlen) < 0) {
449 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
450 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
451 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(10),
452 "bind: %s", strbuf);
453 return (false);
454 }
455
456 if (getsockname(s, (struct sockaddr *)&ss, &len) < 0) {
457 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
458 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
459 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(10),
460 "getsockname: %s", strbuf);
461 return (false);
462 }
463
464 iovec.iov_base = buf;
465 iovec.iov_len = sizeof(buf);
466
467 memset(&msg, 0, sizeof(msg));
468 msg.msg_name = (struct sockaddr *)&ss;
469 msg.msg_namelen = len;
470 msg.msg_iov = &iovec;
471 msg.msg_iovlen = 1;
472 msg.msg_control = (void*)&control;
473 msg.msg_controllen = 0;
474 msg.msg_flags = 0;
475
476 cmsgp = msg.msg_control;
477
478 switch (type) {
479#ifdef IP_TOS
480 case IP_TOS:
481 memset(cmsgp, 0, cmsg_space(sizeof(char)));
482 cmsgp->cmsg_level = level;
483 cmsgp->cmsg_type = type;
484 cmsgp->cmsg_len = cmsg_len(sizeof(char));
485 *(unsigned char*)CMSG_DATA(cmsgp) = dscp;
486 msg.msg_controllen += cmsg_space(sizeof(char));
487 break;
488#endif
489#ifdef IPV6_TCLASS
490 case IPV6_TCLASS:
491 memset(cmsgp, 0, cmsg_space(sizeof(dscp)));
492 cmsgp->cmsg_level = level;
493 cmsgp->cmsg_type = type;
494 cmsgp->cmsg_len = cmsg_len(sizeof(dscp));
495 memmove(CMSG_DATA(cmsgp), &dscp, sizeof(dscp));
496 msg.msg_controllen += cmsg_space(sizeof(dscp));
497 break;
498#endif
499 default:
500 INSIST(0);
501 ISC_UNREACHABLE();
502 }
503
504 if (sendmsg(s, &msg, 0) < 0) {
505 int debug = ISC_LOG_DEBUG(10);
506 const char *typestr;
507 switch (errno) {
508#ifdef ENOPROTOOPT
509 case ENOPROTOOPT:
510#endif
511#ifdef EOPNOTSUPP
512 case EOPNOTSUPP:
513#endif
514 case EINVAL:
515 case EPERM:
516 break;
517 default:
518 debug = ISC_LOG_NOTICE;
519 }
520 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
521 if (debug != ISC_LOG_NOTICE) {
522 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
523 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(10),
524 "sendmsg: %s", strbuf);
525 } else {
526 typestr = (type == IP_TOS) ? "IP_TOS" : "IPV6_TCLASS";
527 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__, "probing "
528 "sendmsg() with %s=%02x failed: %s",
529 typestr, dscp, strbuf);
530 }
531 return (false);
532 }
533
534 /*
535 * Make sure the message actually got sent.
536 */
537 result = make_nonblock(s);
538 RUNTIME_CHECK(result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
539
540 iovec.iov_base = buf;
541 iovec.iov_len = sizeof(buf);
542
543 memset(&msg, 0, sizeof(msg));
544 msg.msg_name = (struct sockaddr *)&ss;
545 msg.msg_namelen = sizeof(ss);
546 msg.msg_iov = &iovec;
547 msg.msg_iovlen = 1;
548 msg.msg_control = NULL;
549 msg.msg_controllen = 0;
550 msg.msg_flags = 0;
551
552 if (recvmsg(s, &msg, 0) < 0)
553 return (false);
554
555 return (true);
556}
557#endif
558
559static void
560try_dscp_v4(void) {
561#ifdef IP_TOS
562 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
563 struct addrinfo hints, *res0;
564 int s, dscp = 0, n;
565#ifdef IP_RECVTOS
566 int on = 1;
567#endif /* IP_RECVTOS */
568
569 memset(&hints, 0, sizeof(hints));
570 hints.ai_family = AF_INET;
571 hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_DGRAM;
572 hints.ai_protocol = IPPROTO_UDP;
573#ifdef AI_NUMERICHOST
574 hints.ai_flags = AI_PASSIVE | AI_NUMERICHOST;
575#else
576 hints.ai_flags = AI_PASSIVE;
577#endif
578
579 n = getaddrinfo("127.0.0.1", NULL, &hints, &res0);
580 if (n != 0 || res0 == NULL) {
581 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
582 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(10),
583 "getaddrinfo(127.0.0.1): %s", gai_strerror(n));
584 return;
585 }
586
587 s = socket(res0->ai_family, res0->ai_socktype, res0->ai_protocol);
588
589 if (s == -1) {
590 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
591 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
592 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(10),
593 "socket: %s", strbuf);
594 freeaddrinfo(res0);
595 return;
596 }
597
598 if (setsockopt(s, IPPROTO_IP, IP_TOS, &dscp, sizeof(dscp)) == 0)
599 dscp_result |= ISC_NET_DSCPSETV4;
600
601#ifdef IP_RECVTOS
602 on = 1;
603 if (setsockopt(s, IPPROTO_IP, IP_RECVTOS, &on, sizeof(on)) == 0)
604 dscp_result |= ISC_NET_DSCPRECVV4;
605#endif /* IP_RECVTOS */
606
607#if ISC_CMSG_IP_TOS
608 if (cmsgsend(s, IPPROTO_IP, IP_TOS, res0))
609 dscp_result |= ISC_NET_DSCPPKTV4;
610#endif /* ISC_CMSG_IP_TOS */
611
612 freeaddrinfo(res0);
613 close(s);
614
615#endif /* IP_TOS */
616}
617
618static void
619try_dscp_v6(void) {
620#ifdef IPV6_TCLASS
621 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
622 struct addrinfo hints, *res0;
623 int s, dscp = 0, n;
624#if defined(IPV6_RECVTCLASS)
625 int on = 1;
626#endif /* IPV6_RECVTCLASS */
627
628 memset(&hints, 0, sizeof(hints));
629 hints.ai_family = AF_INET6;
630 hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_DGRAM;
631 hints.ai_protocol = IPPROTO_UDP;
632#ifdef AI_NUMERICHOST
633 hints.ai_flags = AI_PASSIVE | AI_NUMERICHOST;
634#else
635 hints.ai_flags = AI_PASSIVE;
636#endif
637
638 n = getaddrinfo("::1", NULL, &hints, &res0);
639 if (n != 0 || res0 == NULL) {
640 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
641 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(10),
642 "getaddrinfo(::1): %s", gai_strerror(n));
643 return;
644 }
645
646 s = socket(res0->ai_family, res0->ai_socktype, res0->ai_protocol);
647 if (s == -1) {
648 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
649 isc_log_write(isc_lctx, ISC_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
650 ISC_LOGMODULE_SOCKET, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(10),
651 "socket: %s", strbuf);
652 freeaddrinfo(res0);
653 return;
654 }
655 if (setsockopt(s, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_TCLASS, &dscp, sizeof(dscp)) == 0)
656 dscp_result |= ISC_NET_DSCPSETV6;
657
658#ifdef IPV6_RECVTCLASS
659 on = 1;
660 if (setsockopt(s, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_RECVTCLASS, &on, sizeof(on)) == 0)
661 dscp_result |= ISC_NET_DSCPRECVV6;
662#endif /* IPV6_RECVTCLASS */
663
664 if (cmsgsend(s, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_TCLASS, res0))
665 dscp_result |= ISC_NET_DSCPPKTV6;
666
667 freeaddrinfo(res0);
668 close(s);
669
670#endif /* IPV6_TCLASS */
671}
672
673static void
674try_dscp(void) {
675 try_dscp_v4();
676 try_dscp_v6();
677}
678
679static void
680initialize_dscp(void) {
681 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_once_do(&once_dscp, try_dscp) == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
682}
683
684unsigned int
685isc_net_probedscp(void) {
686 initialize_dscp();
687 return (dscp_result);
688}
689
690#if defined(USE_SYSCTL_PORTRANGE)
691#if defined(HAVE_SYSCTLBYNAME)
692static isc_result_t
693getudpportrange_sysctl(int af, in_port_t *low, in_port_t *high) {
694 int port_low, port_high;
695 size_t portlen;
696 const char *sysctlname_lowport, *sysctlname_hiport;
697
698 if (af == AF_INET) {
699 sysctlname_lowport = SYSCTL_V4PORTRANGE_LOW;
700 sysctlname_hiport = SYSCTL_V4PORTRANGE_HIGH;
701 } else {
702 sysctlname_lowport = SYSCTL_V6PORTRANGE_LOW;
703 sysctlname_hiport = SYSCTL_V6PORTRANGE_HIGH;
704 }
705 portlen = sizeof(port_low);
706 if (sysctlbyname(sysctlname_lowport, &port_low, &portlen,
707 NULL, 0) < 0) {
708 return (ISC_R_FAILURE);
709 }
710 portlen = sizeof(port_high);
711 if (sysctlbyname(sysctlname_hiport, &port_high, &portlen,
712 NULL, 0) < 0) {
713 return (ISC_R_FAILURE);
714 }
715 if ((port_low & ~0xffff) != 0 || (port_high & ~0xffff) != 0)
716 return (ISC_R_RANGE);
717
718 *low = (in_port_t)port_low;
719 *high = (in_port_t)port_high;
720
721 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
722}
723#else /* !HAVE_SYSCTLBYNAME */
724static isc_result_t
725getudpportrange_sysctl(int af, in_port_t *low, in_port_t *high) {
726 int mib_lo4[4] = SYSCTL_V4PORTRANGE_LOW;
727 int mib_hi4[4] = SYSCTL_V4PORTRANGE_HIGH;
728 int mib_lo6[4] = SYSCTL_V6PORTRANGE_LOW;
729 int mib_hi6[4] = SYSCTL_V6PORTRANGE_HIGH;
730 int *mib_lo, *mib_hi, miblen;
731 int port_low, port_high;
732 size_t portlen;
733
734 if (af == AF_INET) {
735 mib_lo = mib_lo4;
736 mib_hi = mib_hi4;
737 miblen = sizeof(mib_lo4) / sizeof(mib_lo4[0]);
738 } else {
739 mib_lo = mib_lo6;
740 mib_hi = mib_hi6;
741 miblen = sizeof(mib_lo6) / sizeof(mib_lo6[0]);
742 }
743
744 portlen = sizeof(port_low);
745 if (sysctl(mib_lo, miblen, &port_low, &portlen, NULL, 0) < 0) {
746 return (ISC_R_FAILURE);
747 }
748
749 portlen = sizeof(port_high);
750 if (sysctl(mib_hi, miblen, &port_high, &portlen, NULL, 0) < 0) {
751 return (ISC_R_FAILURE);
752 }
753
754 if ((port_low & ~0xffff) != 0 || (port_high & ~0xffff) != 0)
755 return (ISC_R_RANGE);
756
757 *low = (in_port_t) port_low;
758 *high = (in_port_t) port_high;
759
760 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
761}
762#endif /* HAVE_SYSCTLBYNAME */
763#endif /* USE_SYSCTL_PORTRANGE */
764
765isc_result_t
766isc_net_getudpportrange(int af, in_port_t *low, in_port_t *high) {
767 int result = ISC_R_FAILURE;
768#if !defined(USE_SYSCTL_PORTRANGE) && defined(__linux)
769 FILE *fp;
770#endif
771
772 REQUIRE(low != NULL && high != NULL);
773
774#if defined(USE_SYSCTL_PORTRANGE)
775 result = getudpportrange_sysctl(af, low, high);
776#elif defined(__linux)
777
778 UNUSED(af);
779
780 /*
781 * Linux local ports are address family agnostic.
782 */
783 fp = fopen("/proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_local_port_range", "r");
784 if (fp != NULL) {
785 int n;
786 unsigned int l, h;
787
788 n = fscanf(fp, "%u %u", &l, &h);
789 if (n == 2 && (l & ~0xffff) == 0 && (h & ~0xffff) == 0) {
790 *low = l;
791 *high = h;
792 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
793 }
794 fclose(fp);
795 }
796#else
797 UNUSED(af);
798#endif
799
800 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
801 *low = ISC_NET_PORTRANGELOW;
802 *high = ISC_NET_PORTRANGEHIGH;
803 }
804
805 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS); /* we currently never fail in this function */
806}
807
808void
809isc_net_disableipv4(void) {
810 initialize();
811 if (ipv4_result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
812 ipv4_result = ISC_R_DISABLED;
813}
814
815void
816isc_net_disableipv6(void) {
817 initialize();
818 if (ipv6_result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
819 ipv6_result = ISC_R_DISABLED;
820}
821
822void
823isc_net_enableipv4(void) {
824 initialize();
825 if (ipv4_result == ISC_R_DISABLED)
826 ipv4_result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
827}
828
829void
830isc_net_enableipv6(void) {
831 initialize();
832 if (ipv6_result == ISC_R_DISABLED)
833 ipv6_result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
834}
